results.title: Prelude
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Orchestra Series”.
The Orchestra series describes the evolution of the modern symphony orchestra from its beginnings in the 17th century to the present. Part One traces the beginnings of the orchestra in the wood-wind bands used for open air music. It shows how the development of opera in the 16th century prepared the way for musical interludes of descriptive and dramatic power, and the program includes a passage from Monteverdi’s “Tancredi and Clorinda”.

results.title: Ecosystems and interactions
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Ecology Series”.
Describes the communities of organisms in ecosystems and explains how they interact with one another and the environment in which they live. Ecosystems are inescapably locked together through nutrient cycles and food chains with a common denominator - the sun - as a source of all energy

results.title: Communities
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Ecology Series”.
Reveals the structure and composition of a rain forest. Displays a myriad of populations living in conjunction with one another as the “rain forest community”. Examines the way the community functions, the factors that cause change, and the way all life is tied to the community structure.

group_works.title: Australian landscape painters
group_works.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Australian landscape painters
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australian Art”.
The Australian artist has no greater challenge than his own landscape, but few have been completely successful in depicting it. Using both the artists’ words and their work, this film studies Sir Russell Drysdale, Tom Roberts and Sir Hans Heysen, and shows why and how they have transmuted landscape into art.

results.title: Scientific and medical research
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
An overview of current scientific and medical research in Australia. Looks briefly at space tracking stations, interscan, solar energy, medical technology, nuclear medicine, microsurgery and the invitro fertilisation program. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates

results.title: Culture and recreation
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
A non-narrated montage of images showing aspects of culture and recreation in Australia, interspersed with some historic footage. Shows sport, dance, historic buildings, the Sydney Opera House, opera performances and festivals. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
